channel.title: The Observatory
channel.description: Images of ONU's astronomical observatory, where most astrophotos on this website were taken. It is equipped with a motorized roof which slides off to allow observation, along with telescopes, detectors, and cameras. See also the Students and Events section!

item.title: Early plans for the ONU Observatory.
item.description: Early plans for the ONU Observatory. The restroom shelter walls were not used in the end.
item.media:description: Early plans for the ONU Observatory. The restroom shelter walls were not used in the end.

item.title: The observatory under construction.
item.description: The observatory under construction. 6/13/2010. The Saturn brickwork is done.
item.media:description: The observatory under construction. 6/13/2010. The Saturn brickwork is done.

item.title: Under construction
item.description: Observatory under construction, showing men working in the control room. A blue roof covering makes everything look blue.
item.media:description: Observatory under construction, showing men working in the control room. A blue roof covering makes everything look blue.

item.title: View of turbines west of the observatory.
item.description: View of turbines west of the observatory. The wind turbines were constructed around the same time as the ONU Observatory. They suffered damages and were taken down in 2021/2022.
item.media:description: View of turbines west of the observatory. The wind turbines were constructed around the same time as the ONU Observatory. They suffered damages and were taken down in 2021/2022.

item.title: Waxing crescent and sunset. 9/10/2010.
item.description: Waxing crescent and sunset viewed from outside of the observatory on 9/10/2010.
item.media:description: Waxing crescent and sunset viewed from outside of the observatory on 9/10/2010.

item.title: Telescopes almost in place. 9/22/2010.
item.description: The interior of the finished observatory, with telescopes. From left to right: 8" Meade LT8 (not yet mounted), 12" Meade LX200, 6" Celestron C5.
item.media:description: The interior of the finished observatory, with telescopes. From left to right: 8" Meade LT8 (not yet mounted), 12" Meade LX200, 6" Celestron C5.

item.title: Daytime Sun viewing. 10/1/2010
item.description: Projecting the Sun with the 6-inch during a daytime tour of the observatory. 10/1/2010.
item.media:description: Projecting the Sun with the 6-inch during a daytime tour of the observatory. 10/1/2010.

item.title: Dr. Pinkney at the ONU observatory. 10/1/2010.
item.description: Dr. Pinkney during a daytime tour of the observatory. 10/1/2010. The blue telescope is the 12-inch Meade, and the white telescope is an 80mm Meade 8000.
item.media:description: Dr. Pinkney during a daytime tour of the observatory. 10/1/2010. The blue telescope is the 12-inch Meade, and the white telescope is an 80mm Meade 8000.

item.title: Dr. Theisen during October 2010 inauguration.
item.description: Dr. Theisen (Physics) chats with visitors during the inaugural event at the ONU observatory.
item.media:description: Dr. Theisen (Physics) chats with visitors during the inaugural event at the ONU observatory.

item.title: Telescopes old (blue) and new (white) during 2010 Inaugural event.
item.description: The Meade LX200 and Meade Apochromatic Refractor during the 2010 Inaugural event.
item.media:description: The Meade LX200 and Meade Apochromatic Refractor during the 2010 Inaugural event.

item.title: Dean Aubrecht during 2010 inaugural event.
item.description: Dean Catherine Aubrecht during the 2010 inaugural event.
item.media:description: Dean Catherine Aubrecht during the 2010 inaugural event.

item.title: The ONU Observatory in the snow. 12/13/10.
item.description: The ONU Observatory in the snow. 12/13/10.
item.media:description: The ONU Observatory in the snow. 12/13/10.

item.title: A student takes an astrophoto. 12/15/10.
item.description: A student takes an astrophoto through the eyepiece of the 12" with the old Canon Rebel XT. 12/15/10. Long exposure by ONU photographer Ken C.
item.media:description: A student takes an astrophoto through the eyepiece of the 12" with the old Canon Rebel XT. 12/15/10. Long exposure by ONU photographer Ken C.

item.title: Night viewing with red lights on. 4/5/11.
item.description: The observatory at night, with red lighting to preserve dark adaptation. 4/5/11.
item.media:description: The observatory at night, with red lighting to preserve dark adaptation. 4/5/11.

item.title: Observatory with roof retracted. 5/24/11.
item.description: The observatory with the roof retracted, ready for a night of astronomy.
item.media:description: The observatory with the roof retracted, ready for a night of astronomy.

item.title: ONU Observatory on vacation in Arizona.
item.description: ONU Observatory on vacation in Arizona. (Composite with a star trail taken on Kitt Peak in Arizona.)
item.media:description: ONU Observatory on vacation in Arizona. (Composite with a star trail taken on Kitt Peak in Arizona.)

item.title: Astronomy students observing on 3/13/12.
item.description: Astronomy Club members (and physics majors) pose for a photo at the observatory on 3/13/12.
item.media:description: Astronomy Club members (and physics majors) pose for a photo at the observatory on 3/13/12.

item.title: Refractor with Sun funnel.
item.description: This cheap refractor works well with a sun funnel to observe the sun projected on a plane of wax paper.
item.media:description: This cheap refractor works well with a sun funnel to observe the sun projected on a plane of wax paper.

item.title: ONU Observatory open for an evening event. 7/6/17.
item.description: ONU Observatory open for an evening event on July 6, 2017. Black light lamps are used but most other lights are off to improve night vision.
item.media:description: ONU Observatory open for an evening event on July 6, 2017. Black light lamps are used but most other lights are off to improve night vision.

item.title: Projecting the Sun. 3/8/13.
item.description: Projecting the Sun on a sheet using the Celestron 6-inch. 3/8/13.
item.media:description: Projecting the Sun on a sheet using the Celestron 6-inch. 3/8/13.
